name: Brittany Mcneal
text: I have only been attending Ross for a week but since day one in have felt very welcome there. The instructors are great! They have great student teacher relationships. My first two days i wanted to run away screaming because it was a lot to take in. But I didn't and I stuck with it and I'm so glad I did because I love it!

name: Christina Miller
text: I completed my Veterinary Assisting program at Ross Medical Education Center and I'm so grateful that I enrolled 9 months ago. The teachers/staff are great, and have really prepared me for my career. I recommend this program to anyone wanting to further their education in Veterinary Medicine!

name: Anteara Fletcher-Rice
text: I really enjoyed the experience at Ross it definitely opens up a wide range of variety with what you could do after as far as going back to school. Great teachers and classmates. Its a different experience for everyone but overall its a great place to have a new start!

name: Kierra Suggs
text: The staff is wonderful especially my instructor i love her (Vet Assistant). I like how they keep in connect with you after you're finish with school. My externship is awesome. I will be done next week. If you aren't doing anything apply to this school you will not regret it.

name: Kayla Collier
text: I had an awesome time learning at Ross Medical Education Center. The staff were all so nice and helpful. The instructors are great at their jobs and learned a great deal from them.

name: lindsey dukes
text: This school is a joke! I had a scheduled meeting with the admissions office to get information about their vet program since they were unable to send information through the mail. When I first arrived, I had to fill out a life questionnaire and turn it in. Once I got in my meeting, 95% of the meeting was asking rather personal questions about my personal life rather than going over what the school had to offer me. I was told I would need 2 vehicles to attend. Within 10 minutes of my scheduled meeting, the advisor asked me to hold on so she can go consult another "potential student" who had a meeting. After waiting in my scheduled meeting for several minutes while she talks to another potential student (which made me feel like I wasn't important) she returns to finally start reviewing about the program. About 5 minutes in, she left the meeting again to talk to a different "potential" student. I was told they do not hire teachers, they hire professionals that only require 3 years of training. I asked several times about financial aid options and was given no information. I then inquired about how I could use this program as a bridge to become a future vet and the lady told me that being a vet was hard work and lots of money and it probably wont happen for me. She mentioned that once I graduate, they could not guarantee me a job. Then when she realized that I was only there for information and not immediately ready to start, she shut the whole meeting down and told me that there are people waiting in the lobby who want to start classes now and require her attention more than I and to return when I am ready. She quickly handed me a brochure and I left. I would not recommended this school to anyone. Very unprofessional!

name: Kenyatae Haygood-Cable
text: I'm a recent MMIBOA graduate from Ross! I started in May 2017 and completed the entire program in December 2017. I enjoyed my experience here & looking forward to working in my field with help from career services, Jeff, Melissa, & Veronica do their best to help the students become successful in their desired work field!

name: Breauna Waldrep
text: I've been at Ross for about 2 months now and everything is great, i love Mrs. Hereford and Mrs. B they are the best teachers I have ever had in any school experience. Mrs. Hereford is really hands on and teaches great ! she is by far my favorite teacher. Any time i ask for help she is there to guide me through it, and helps so much. Mrs. B is the same way and is very helpful as well. The Only DOWNFALL is our break.  i understand time management and everything else but how do you expect people to go get lunch and eat it within TEN MINUTES. Then on top of that the higher up people want to say it is important to eat but we have no machines for food , or drinks for our breaks. Not even a fridge or microwave to bring our lunch. i would bring my lunch if i had a way to keep it cold or heat it up. If your thirsty and need something to drink we have to walk next door. If we had a fridge or a microwave it would probably cut down on money for everyone and stop students being out of the classroom longer than the scheduled ten minutes.

name: Tamekia Key
text: The Medical Center was wonderful. I loved the small classes and the hands on experience. Dr. Bolden was amazing. I drove 5 days a week from Muscle Shoals and it was every quater.

name: Antarea Fletcher-Rice
text: This school is simply AMAZING!!! It's like my second family. Everyone is helpful and very supportive and encouraging! I Highly recommend this school.

name: Allison Purvines
text: Had a great time, and met a lot of new friends!!  Great learning experience, however the time goes by really fast and you must be willing to put in the work to get the most out of your experience.

name: Dominique Grays
text: Great college to attend. The support is there, the knowledge is there and you can be come apart of a great family. Thanks Ross for bettering my future.

name: Kenyatae Haygood-Cable
text: I'm a recent MMIBOA graduate from Ross! I started in May 2017 and completed the entire program in December 2017. I enjoyed my experience here & looking forward to working in my field with help from career services, Jeff, Melissa, & Veronica do their best to help the students become successful in their desired work field!

name: Lana Summerford
text: Overall I would recommend this school for anyone who is seeking to work in the medical trade. However, I feel like some subjects can be broken down better.

name: Georgia Hernandez
text: Attending Ross was a great decision. With my prior work experience in the medical field and with the things I learned at Ross, I was hired at my externship site 3 weeks in.  I am forever grateful with Ross because I am now a working Medical Assistant.

name: Terieka McGhee
text: The 9 months spent in MIBOA night  classes went by very fast. I enjoyed my time at my extern site, can't believe it's almost over.

name: Wendy Tolbert
text: Ross Medical is a really great school. They are so supportive and helped me find my career path.

name: Stacy Long
text: I agree this school is a complete joke. Don’t waste your time or money here!! Leaving was the best decision I ever made. Be cautious!

name: Kayla Brewer
text: It is an incredible school with friendly staff who will help you in reaching your goal towards a new career. I recommend Ross Medical Education Center to anyone who is looking for a new career.

name: Victoria Hansen
text: Enjoyed my time at Ross Medical. Learned so much, and the staff are always friendly and nice. They always helped me with any questions or concerned i had. Whether it was school related, job related, or externship related.

name: Jasmine Case
text: This is the best school I've been to. They care about what you are learning and how you are doing in school and after.

name: Sabrina Wall
text: Every one at Ross was very helpful to me the entire time I've been here! I've gained many new friendships!

name: Tracie Banderob
text: I’m going to first start off with this.i went for medical assistant.  The admissions counselor was great. She was very friendly and informative. She seemed to really care about you. Also there is 1 really good instructor there. I met one only  1 ! But then there are the other instructors. One instructor in clinical didn’t seem to care at all on my first day school that I was behind as well as many other students. She rushed through the course work. And had the personality and enthusiasm of a rock. Very dull didn’t act like she wanted to be there at all !! I kept reaching out for help she didn’t care. Then in administrative the teacher is a JOKE !!! She took a personal call in the middle class, allowed other students from other classes to walk in and begin loud conversations with her , she threatened students saying” don’t let ghetto Kesha come out” she didn’t teach just threw home work out to you. She didn’t instruct on anything, she didn’t telll you how to get to anything like how to access your books which are on the computer or the information needed to complete your home work. Students ! I mean students were printing off the. Papers needed to complete assignemts. I depended solely on the other students to help me and teach me. She was absolutely not professional!I dropped out after day 3!!! This is a warning to all other future students.

name: Tiana Robinson
text: The Dental Program is exciting and you get hands on experience.

name: Samantha Roberts
text: I have had a very positive experience at Ross; I was in the pharmacy technician program and my teacher Ms.Avery is awesome

name: Marcus Walker
text: I am a recent graduate of the Huntsville Al campus. I did the night medical assistant course. I will say that I wish the school was more selective with its students or required the students to pass an actual entrance exam to be able to go to school here.

name: Shondreona Powers
text: my teachers are the best so happy I attend this school.

name: Apryl Arthurs
text: Good decision. Staff are awesome and I feel prepared for a career change.

name: Megan Posey
text: I am glad I made the decision to start school here at Ross. It didnt take to long to get through the classes, and i got hired on at my extern site. Hard work pays off!

name: Koriyan Holmes
text: I loved the MIBOA program, my teacher Ms. Caudle was the best teacher I've  ever had!

name: Natividad Pascual-Andres
text: I love this place soooo much.!! LOVE THE INSTRUCTORS.

name: Jennifer Gardner
text: Wonderful school and atmosphere! Got a job before I finished my externship!

name: Sonja Kimble
text: I've had an extremely wonderful excellence this far and would recommend Ross to family and friends .The only negative is student add is a hassle and very stressful complicated more than it should be.

name: Ola Jefferson
text: I really enjoyed my experience at Ross and at my externship site!!

name: Jherika Hackler
text: I have a great experience from start to finish!

name: Ateavia Lacy
text: I really enjoyed the program, it was a great experience!

name: Linda Sithole
text: wonderful school with an amazing learning atmosphere

name: Cleopatra Stewart
text: I am a proud graduate from Ross Medical Education Center in Huntsville, AL. Thanks to Ross I have job in my field for medical assistant.

name: Clemencia Carlberg
text: Had a great time at Ross!

name: Ahnna Estes
text: Great school!

text: I have only been attending Ross for a week but since day one in have felt very welcome there. The instructors are great! They have great student teacher relationships. text: The staff is wonderful especially my instructor i love her (Vet Assistant). I like how they keep in connect with you after you're finish with school. My externship is awesome. I will be done next week. If you aren't doing anything apply to this school you will not regret it.

name: Kayla Collier
text: I had an awesome time learning at Ross Medical Education Center. The staff were all so nice and helpful. The instructors are great at their jobs and learned a great deal from them.

name: lindsey dukes
text: This school is a joke! I had a scheduled meeting with the admissions office to get information about their vet program since they were unable to send information through the mail. When I first arrived, I had to fill out a life questionnaire and turn it in. Once I got in my meeting, 95% of the meeting was asking rather personal questions about my personal life rather than going over what the school had to offer me. I was told I would need 2 vehicles to attend. Within 10 minutes of my scheduled meeting, the advisor asked me to hold on so she can go consult another "potential student" who had a meeting. After waiting in my scheduled meeting for several minutes while she talks to another potential student (which made me feel like I wasn't important) she returns to finally start reviewing about the program. About 5 minutes in, she left the meeting again to talk to a different "potential" student. I was told they do not hire teachers, they hire professionals that only require 3 years of training. I asked several times about financial aid options and was given no information. I then inquired about how I could use this program as a bridge to become a future vet and the lady told me that being a vet was hard work and lots of money and it probably wont happen for me. She mentioned that once I graduate, they could not guarantee me a job. Then when she realized that I was only there for information and not immediately ready to start, she shut the whole meeting down and told me that there are people waiting in the lobby who want to start classes now and require her attention more than I and to return when I am ready. She quickly handed me a brochure and I left. I would not recommended this school to anyone. Very unprofessional!

name: Kenyatae Haygood-Cable
text: I'm a recent MMIBOA graduate from Ross! I started in May 2017 and completed the entire program in December 2017. I enjoyed my experience here & looking forward to working in my field with help from career services, Jeff, Melissa, & Veronica do their best to help the students become successful in their desired work field!

name: Breauna Waldrep
text: I've been at Ross for about 2 months now and everything is great, i love Mrs. Hereford and Mrs. B they are the best teachers I have ever had in any school experience. Mrs. Hereford is really hands on and teaches great ! she is by far my favorite teacher. Any time i ask for help she is there to guide me through it, and helps so much. Mrs. B is the same way and is very helpful as well. The Only DOWNFALL is our break.  i understand time management and everything else but how do you expect people to go get lunch and eat it within TEN MINUTES. Then on top of that the higher up people want to say it is important to eat but we have no machines for food , or drinks for our breaks. Not even a fridge or microwave to bring our lunch. i would bring my lunch if i had a way to keep it cold or heat it up. If your thirsty and need something to drink we have to walk next door. If we had a fridge or a microwave it would probably cut down on money for everyone and stop students being out of the classroom longer than the scheduled ten minutes.

name: Tamekia Key
text: The Medical Center was wonderful. I loved the small classes and the hands on experience. Dr. Bolden was amazing. I drove 5 days a week from Muscle Shoals and it was every quater.

name: Antarea Fletcher-Rice
text: This school is simply AMAZING!!! It's like my second family. Everyone is helpful and very supportive and encouraging! I Highly recommend this school.

name: Allison Purvines
text: Had a great time, and met a lot of new friends!!  Great learning experience, however the time goes by really fast and you must be willing to put in the work to get the most out of your experience.

name: Dominique Grays
text: Great college to attend. The support is there, the knowledge is there and you can be come apart of a great family. Thanks Ross for bettering my future.

name: Kenyatae Haygood-Cable
text: I'm a recent MMIBOA graduate from Ross! I started in May 2017 and completed the entire program in December 2017. I enjoyed my experience here & looking forward to working in my field with help from career services, Jeff, Melissa, & Veronica do their best to help the students become successful in their desired work field!

name: Lana Summerford
text: Overall I would recommend this school for anyone who is seeking to work in the medical trade. However, I feel like some subjects can be broken down better.

name: Georgia Hernandez
text: Attending Ross was a great decision. With my prior work experience in the medical field and with the things I learned at Ross, I was hired at my externship site 3 weeks in.  I am forever grateful with Ross because I am now a working Medical Assistant.

name: Terieka McGhee
text: The 9 months spent in MIBOA night  classes went by very fast. I enjoyed my time at my extern site, can't believe it's almost over.

name: Wendy Tolbert
text: Ross Medical is a really great school. They are so supportive and helped me find my career path.

name: Stacy Long
text: I agree this school is a complete joke. Don’t waste your time or money here!! Leaving was the best decision I ever made. Be cautious!

name: Kayla Brewer
text: It is an incredible school with friendly staff who will help you in reaching your goal towards a new career. I recommend Ross Medical Education Center to anyone who is looking for a new career.

name: Victoria Hansen
text: Enjoyed my time at Ross Medical. Learned so much, and the staff are always friendly and nice. They always helped me with any questions or concerned i had. Whether it was school related, job related, or externship related.

name: Jasmine Case
text: This is the best school I've been to. They care about what you are learning and how you are doing in school and after.

name: Sabrina Wall
text: Every one at Ross was very helpful to me the entire time I've been here! I've gained many new friendships!

name: Tracie Banderob
text: I’m going to first start off with this.i went for medical assistant.  The admissions counselor was great. She was very friendly and informative. She seemed to really care about you. Also there is 1 really good instructor there. I met one only  1 ! But then there are the other instructors. One instructor in clinical didn’t seem to care at all on my first day school that I was behind as well as many other students. She rushed through the course work. And had the personality and enthusiasm of a rock. Very dull didn’t act like she wanted to be there at all !! I kept reaching out for help she didn’t care. Then in administrative the teacher is a JOKE !!! She took a personal call in the middle class, allowed other students from other classes to walk in and begin loud conversations with her , she threatened students saying” don’t let ghetto Kesha come out” she didn’t teach just threw home work out to you. She didn’t instruct on anything, she didn’t telll you how to get to anything like how to access your books which are on the computer or the information needed to complete your home work. Students ! I mean students were printing off the. Papers needed to complete assignemts. I depended solely on the other students to help me and teach me. She was absolutely not professional!I dropped out after day 3!!! This is a warning to all other future students.

name: Tiana Robinson
text: The Dental Program is exciting and you get hands on experience.

name: Samantha Roberts
text: I have had a very positive experience at Ross; I was in the pharmacy technician program and my teacher Ms.Avery is awesome

name: Marcus Walker
text: I am a recent graduate of the Huntsville Al campus. I did the night medical assistant course. I will say that I wish the school was more selective with its students or required the students to pass an actual entrance exam to be able to go to school here.

name: Shondreona Powers
text: my teachers are the best so happy I attend this school.

name: Apryl Arthurs
text: Good decision. Staff are awesome and I feel prepared for a career change.

name: Megan Posey
text: I am glad I made the decision to start school here at Ross. It didnt take to long to get through the classes, and i got hired on at my extern site. Hard work pays off!

name: Koriyan Holmes
text: I loved the MIBOA program, my teacher Ms. Caudle was the best teacher I've  ever had!

name: Natividad Pascual-Andres
text: I love this place soooo much.!! LOVE THE INSTRUCTORS.

name: Jennifer Gardner
text: Wonderful school and atmosphere! Got a job before I finished my externship!

name: Sonja Kimble
text: I've had an extremely wonderful excellence this far and would recommend Ross to family and friends .The only negative is student add is a hassle and very stressful complicated more than it should be.

name: Ola Jefferson
text: I really enjoyed my experience at Ross and at my externship site!!

name: Jherika Hackler
text: I have a great experience from start to finish!

name: Ateavia Lacy
text: I really enjoyed the program, it was a great experience!

name: Linda Sithole
text: wonderful school with an amazing learning atmosphere

name: Cleopatra Stewart
text: I am a proud graduate from Ross Medical Education Center in Huntsville, AL. Thanks to Ross I have job in my field for medical assistant.

name: Clemencia Carlberg
text: Had a great time at Ross!

name: Ahnna Estes
text: Great school!

name: Randy Latner
text: I've been teaching at this school going on 5 years and to say it's a "one of a kind" school is an understatement.  I've visited many career tech centers all over the state including one in Georgia and our facilities are top of the line in comparison. Every visitor to our school is amazed by all thats in the building and the most common thing I hear is, "I never knew all this was in here." So if you haventhe chance to visit or send a student to take one of our many courses, they won't regret it.

name: Wil Bowman
text: TCTA is a great institution. They're leading the efforts for technical career training in Tuscaloosa.

name: Mona Hardy
text: Glad they made the Children A Career Center

name: Em Wa
text: Our family and friends share a wonderful relationship with The Hillsborough School -- Dr. Bray, leadership, teachers and students. Although our two children do not attend Hillsborough because we live far away, you don't have to be at Hillsborough long to immediately feel the draw, peace, respect and enjoyable learning that's in the air! Thanks to Hillsborough, our children have enjoyed the opportunity to participate in FIRST LEGO League Robotics the last several years. The students and leadership at Hillsborough are LARGELY responsible for connecting our children to what has become a passion and joy for them. If you are considering Hillsborough, go spend some time with these wonderful people that help students and parents enjoy and love learning!

name: LUKE TV 4 KIDS
text: My preschooler had such an amazing experience at the Hillsboro school. From the first moment he walked in the door he was greeted by warm, gentle, friendly teachers. They guided him through the room and made him feel comfortable and at home. The environment of the school is one of calm and the atmosphere is peaceful. Just how a school should be! The Hillsboro school is also thoroughly equipped with a wide variety of learning tools that are creative and outside the box of normal learning methods.  The children are given independence to explore and learn on their own but also with gentle one on one guidance from the teacher when needed.  My child often talks about the Hillsboro school and wants to go back and each day when he was there he didn’t want to leave. The staff, vision, and educational methods are a cut above the rest.

name: Jessica Estrada
text: When I was looking for a school to renew my son's love of learning, the Hillsboro School was quickly the obvious choice! The creative learning and multi-faceted integration of all subjects is perfect for his learning style and has renewed his love of exploring our world. In fact, on days that they do not have school he misses it so much that he wishes they didn't have a break! The teachers and students are more like a family and the care and attention is nurturing and encouraging. It is a beautiful sight to see my son flourish!

name: Sammie Robertson
text: The Hillsboro School is so much more than a facility or curriculum.  To us, it's a family of supportive and understanding educators that truly care about our child and finding the best ways for him to enjoy learning and exploring the world.  In our first year they have already changed the way we look at education and community, in the most wonderful ways.

name: Susan Schuman
text: The Hillsboro School is an amazing place!  We're constantly impressed with the learning opportunities, student achievements, and the outstanding staff.   Coming from a public school environment we quickly saw a huge difference in my son's enthusiasm for learning and it hasn't slowed down at all.  I love the way the teachers work with the students to understand how each individual learns best and then gives them the tools and freedom to do so.  My son is thriving in ways I never expected!  Watching him rush out the door each morning to get to school is something I never thought I'd see.  It's truly a wonderful school environment where every single person feels like family.  We couldn't ask for more!

name: Kurt Edwards
text: The teachers at the Hillsboro School are truly exceptional with outstanding educational credentials.  The low student-to-teacher ratio means that my son's learning plan is custom-tailored to his individual needs.  He can progress in his learning at the speed that is best for him.  He is having truly creative learning opportunities including designing and building robots to participating in extended field trips at historic locations.

name: Evan Koch
text: We started out with our son in Hillsboro School and are happy to have both our daughter enrolled as well. The smaller class sizes allow the teachers to work with each of the children, delivering the material in a way that's based on the child. The interaction with other children of varying ages I believe has helped our children grow, and the feeling of community within the school helps us feel at home at Hillsboro.

name: Amy Stump
text: Our journey with The Hillsboro School was a gift.  I recognized the enthusiasm of the director but had no way of knowing the magnitude of our decision to enroll our kids.  I thought it was a good fit just because they would allow the kids to work at advanced levels in those subjects where they excelled and would make sure they didn’t fall behind in those subjects where they did not excel.  We got so much more.  Our kids were sponges for the hands-on methods.  They were encouraged to ask “why” and pursue where it went.  They were given the confidence to think for themselves.   The teachers worked with the kids, understood their learning styles and gave them personalized tools (organizational as well as processing) to help them focus on what is important. Because of those efforts that you just can’t find anywhere else, my kids can answer a question clearly, explain their opinions and defend their positions easily.  I am grateful to The Hillsboro School!

name: Tammy Lax
text: My niece began attending Hillsboro School this year as a Freshman.  Although apprehensive at first, she has embraced the routine and loves that her individuality is championed instead of discouraged. Living out of state, I appreciate that they create opportunities to include extended family.  The school hosted a Thanksigiving lunch for families, and the Christmas craft fair was so much fun!

name: Jeff Hansen
text: It has truly been a pleasure to watch my child bloom during their time at Hillsboro.  Coming from public school, there was a 180 degree change to a kid who actually enjoys school and appreciates learning.

name: Hoyt Middleton
text: People were attentive and very helpful

resp.text: Thank you, Hoyt! Best wishes on all your future endeavors.

name: Ray Reynolds
text: Love this school. Great staff, amazing teachers, and a quality Christian education.

name: Anthony Chaney
text: Great school. We have notice a big difference in my sons education. The teacher actually take pride in what they do.

name: Lindsey Chaney
text: 5 stars hands down! Our son has a health condition and also struggles some academically. We had him in public school for over 5 years and LOVED the school he was in, but it was growing so large that we felt our child was being left behind. We decided to set up a meeting with the SCA principal so that we could learn more about the school. We left with great feelings and knew that this would be our son's new school! We have now been there for 2 years and don't regret a thing! Our son loves this school and so do we! If you are looking for a positive change in your child's education, then I highly recommend SCA!

name: Eliception
text: Amazing, quality, Christian school. One of the best, if not THE BEST.

name: Isaiah Edwards
text: Mediocre at best. Left a bad taste in my mouth.

name: Tyler Wilson
text: They literally told me I had to get signatures from all 5 of my professors to withdraw and I seriously don’t have time to chase down 5 people. At Troy it was so easy. It’s like I’m jumping through hoops for a decision that’s mine anyways. My GPA is screwed, but I’ll know better next time.

name: Leticia Sutton
text: Love 💗 love 💓 this school..... Everyone and everything about this school is amazing.... I feel like we are all family helping each other become better then we were before we started there!!!

name: Napalmbukake
text: The welding program is a joke. You're better off saving the tuition money and buying your own welding box to practice with then find a different accredited tester on the AWS website to get your cert

name: Ashley Simmons
text: Signed up for the welding class for women. It wasn't that bad as I thought it would be, enjoyed myself.

name: Adam Weaver
text: Great atmosphere, friendly people, smart instructors. 10 of 10.

name: JAMES WILLIAMS
text: I know this is a good college, but they do not offer the small engine class any longer. Wished they still had it for the public. Was told that class is now only taught for prison inmates.

name: Chris Hartley
text: Instructors are interested in student success. They try to provide a great learning experience.

name: Wasted
text: Ok school

name: Moth Balls
text: Great place, helpful and understanding staff.

name: Brandy Dowdey
text:
I am a current employee who graduated from Wallace Community College. As a student it was the best move for me to make immediately following high school as I was not socially ready to attend a major university. At Wallace Community College I learned how to study for collegiate level classes and manage my time in such a way that differed from high school. All of the courses I took transferred seamlessly to Auburn University which saved me money.
Now as an employee I see all that goes on behind the scenes. I love my job and see all the time an effort faculty and staff put forth to make the learning environment and this college experience the best it can be.

name: Autumn Patterson
text: I love Wallace!! The faculty are wonderful and really pushed me to do my best!  I could always go to them outside of class for help, and even faculty who weren't my teachers helped me on occasion. I will always highly recommend this CC to anyone!!

name: Gene and Marilyn McFalls
text: Wallace Community College is one of the Best colleges in the world.  The advisors are excellent. The Professors are attentive and they genuinely want their students to succeed!  There are tutering available and very professional staff to accommodate the educational experience to success. I give this College a Five STAR rating.  I am happy to be a part of the Wallace family.

name: Heidi Dansby
text: I love going to school here.

name: Summer Knight
text: Can get a real job going to Wallace with a real skill.

name: Neshia Vickers
text: It was a great school when I was attending but now I can't get back in because I left when had my baby and now I want to go back I can't get back in so 1star for them they could give me a second chance at my career in LIFE

resp.text:
Hi Neshia,
We are sorry that you had to leave. Send us an email at wccdothan@gmail.com so we can get in touch.

name: Anubus77
text: They have a Chickfila! 🍗 I'm going to stop by just to eat!

name: Sharon Adams
text: I was given the best foundation of my life to succeed . I'll never forget the experience and the professors that believed in me.

name: Justin Walker
text: The staff never answers phones. I've been calling for weeks and can't never get in touch!!! Now school starts Aug. 22 and I think I'm to late for sign ups! I called again today and called every option just to speak to SOMEBODY there but, once again no answer. I heard great things about Wallace and that's why I choose to go there but, they are probably the worst in communication skills!!!!  my name is charity enfinger and I would really like to be in the nail tech program but, due to poor communication skills from ALL the staff I've missed my opportunity to get a better career for my two baby girls. One is 7 months and the other is 2. I wish I could get in if only they'd answer the phone!!! :(

resp.text:
Justin/Charity! You aren't too late to sign up! You can sign up through Aug. 23.

During registration, it is best to come in or send an email. We help students on a walk-up basis, so no appointment is needed, so we can't always answer the phone. Please know that we want to talk to you and we definitely want you in the nail tech program!

Please send an email to wccdothan@gmail.com with a telephone number and we will have someone call you ASAP!

name: Jennifer SCREWS
text: Guided me thru my success

resp.text: Thanks Jennifer! Let us know if we can help you and good luck in everything you do!

name: Katelyn Hickmon
text: Can't get the staff do to there jobs. No communication skills no help.

resp.text:
Hi Katelyn
We're sorry that you're having problems getting something done. Can you send us an email at wccdothan@gmail.com so that we can help you get what you need?

WCC was closed Dec. 23-Jan. 2 for Winter Break, but we are open Monday-Thursday, 7:30 am  to 4:30 pm and Friday 7:30 am to 2 pm.

Send us a note and let us know what we can do to help!

Thanks!

name: Linessa Vickers
text: Love the staff of Wallace college

name: Luhh Kelo
text: you guys are the worst

resp.text:
Keylan,
We're sorry you think that we're the worst.
Email us at wccdothan@gmail.com and let us know what we can do to be the best for you!

name: Grace French
text: Awesome

name: Faleshia Griffin
text: Work

name: Kenneth W Sanders
text: Woman

name: Wyck3d Cl0wn
text: Comming together very nicely... Love being one of the workers for this site!

name: Joe Watts
text: Always wonderful produce. They have some of the best produce available in Birmingham. In addition to the standard fare (arugula, kale, etc), they usually have fun, unusual things like lemongrass, turmeric, ginger, blue collards and some wonderful Italian greens. Always friendly, this is one of my favorite places to get vegetables. If you visit, be sure to notice the Chimney Swift tower that they have installed on the grounds!

name: Pelham Morris
text: If you like fresh LOCALLY GROWN produce...the likes of which Bottega and Che Fon Fon purchase their greens...SUPPORT THESE GREAT PEOPLE! They are teaching the youth about farming, something I wish had been a part of my childhood...

name: Zee Wilson
text: Amazing people and amazing food. They treat you like family

name: Elizabeth Battle
text: A hands on learning experience

name: Tpa Hoops
text: Truly a blessed place. Real Kingdom church

name: Jake Alexander
text: I dont know where to begin about this place. It truly has been an amazing experience not only for my daughter but with myself and interacting with the faculty here. Each and every individual truly has your child's best interests at heart. Watching my daughter grow and learn these last 15 months is remarkable and its all due to the dedication and and the love from the teachers and administrators.  Definitely glad we found this place.

name: North-East
text: Been here for 8 years pretty cool

name: Stephanie Cornwell
text: Beautiful. A celebration of life for Leigh Ann Richey. The first time my daughter and I had attended there. Amazing!!!

name: Black Brothers Lawn Service
text: A large portion of the congregation is a close knit community. Those who are not are not ostracized but welcome to join. They go out of their way to make you feel welcome. The pastors are not a bunch of know it alls but seem to be in pursuit of truth. I went to an event the other night right after work. I smelled like a sweatsock but the pastor's wife treated me like a lifelong friend. The building was full of the joy of the Lord. I laughed myself to tears a couple of times. I left so refreshed and encouraged that I found myself looking forward to going back. By the way, I usually dislike church people.

name: Donna Gillon
text: So wonderful to be back at the original place I started. The message was wonderful every thing I needed. IT IS WELL WITH MY SOUL.

name: Leon Crauswell
text: As a visitor I found the church personable; I also enjoyed worship and preaching.

name: Michael “Ike” Tidmore
text: Awesome experience the power of the holy ghost filled the entire service. Hallelujah

name: Broderick Thorpe
text: Excellent Experience

name: Janie Parsons
text: It was nice

name: Cindy Long
text: The best staff and school ever

name: Donnie Martin
text: Very nice place to take your kids. You can learn about so many things. Lots to do!!

name: greg ankney
text: Very educational for all ages ... grandchildren really enjoyed the touch tanks and other interactive things

name: JD Thorne
text: Friendly staff. Fun time for kids off all ages.

name: Jeff Johnson
text: Had a great time on a two day field trip for 4th and 5th grades. Our DISL guide Mrs. Virginia was awesome, parents and students all learned something. The dorms are nice and clean, might need extra blankets if traveling in the winter early spring. The cafeteria meals were ok, but the place was always very clean and the ladies were very friendly. The Estuarium reminded me of a very small Chattanooga aquarium.

name: Alexandria Parker (Princess)
text: I liked it! It was fun and I loved the boat ride and walking on the beach!

name: Susan McKinney
text: Went to the sea lab with the grandkids today.. they had such a good time. It's educational as well as interactive. Time we'll spent.

name: Kacey Mullinax
text: We spent the day and had a blast!The kids got to pet the sting rays and sea life was displayed and experience was wonderful.

name: Vic Keasler
text: Great place very much so worth the money.

name: Chris Hayes
text: We loved the island, it was great as a family vacation. It wasn't too expensive, a few things to do but you're on a island so go to the beach. We loved the ocean and the walls on the beach in the morning and the evening. It was a family oriented place and to boot you could take the ferry across to the the main land and pick up what you need. It was a adventure touring the old fort and the way they used to love. We can't wait to go back next year.

name: PetuniaRomania
text: Love this place and definitely worth the visit.

name: Bjoern Hamberger
text: Well worth the visit and support. Lots to learn for the kids. Walking distance from ferry, car not essential, but it was too cold that day for foot passengers (no shelter on the boat). The aquarium is highly recommendable.

name: Dee Beeler
text: Our daughter is 15 years old and absolutely loved the Sealab.There is a lot of info on the Gulf,the Bays and watershed.There are a wide variety of sea creatures and sealife to interact with. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable with information about how pollution, oil and humans can impact the ecosystem. You can pet stingrays and observe marine life while visiting. A gift shop with a variety of items is inside to finish off your trip. Prices are reasonable.

name: Jessica Kelley
text: I came as a kid twice for field trips and came back as an adult for an education training. I love this place! Great place for learning and the food was better than I remembered, lol.

name: Greg McGill
text: Wonderful field trip for students of all ages. Plentiful and delicious cafeteria food which was a pleasant surprise. Our school group had a great time and learned a bit about field science and lab work.

name: Chris Cureton
text: Went for a school field trip, staff was great food was also pretty good. Rooms were basic but were all we needed. All together made for a great trip for all the kids.

name: Jerri Ledford
text: Great, educational (and fun) place to take the littles. The volunteers that work here are all very nice and most are also very knowledgeable.

name: Melanie Klaas
text: Great experience for all ages. So much to see and learn. Take the ferry and some bicycles over to explore.

name: Mike McHugh
text: Best kept eatery secret on Dauphin Island! Great food, Great family setting, great Service, Happy Friendly May's Cafe!

name: Wayne Church
text: Great resource for University of Alabama student to learn Marine science and members of the public to learn about the bay and Gulf

name: Jamie Gould
text: This is the most amazing place to relax and learn about aquatic life!

name: Steven Tancredi
text: Kids loved it. Especially the interaction with the stingrays and horseshoe crab

name: Danielle Wright
text: We had a lot of fun! It was the perfect size. (Not too big that the kids got bored)

name: PurpleCat_18
text: We go every chance we can. Love the Discovery Day they have every year.

name: Vickie Stanford
text: Had a great time. Learned alot

name: Pamela H
text: LOVE this place! Excellent for family time.

name: Sara Farlow
text: Lots of fun and information for the entire family. My toddlers loved it and so did we.

name: Tooter Curry
text: great experience for the kids kind of small but educational if you are not staying on Dauphin Island be sure to take the ferry it is a fun ride out into the bay we enjoyed it a lot as a family

name: Marshall Mears
text: A lot to look at! Ea exhibition is explained on cards. You can get close to aquariums.

name: Candy Mainard
text: Very informative. Maybe more exhibits?

name: Greg Hitt
text: Great place to take the kids. Be prepared to change your clothes

name: Donna Fuller
text: Had a great time seeing all of the sea life that is in the Gulf of Mexico. Loved it.

name: Shirley Olson
text: A fun place for young and old!

name: Carolyn Mai
text: Great place. Fun touching sea creature and learn more about them

name: Susan Smith
text: Not enough interaction for Children ages 3and6 they were both bored and also expensive.

name: Miranda Wilkes
text: Educational and fun for the entire family.

name: Nicole Nassar
text: This place does excellent work! You can book a tour in advance and they also welcome volunteers!

name: Henry Roberts
text: Great place to tour while you’re on the island. Pet the sting rays!

name: Kenneth Taylor
text: Well worth the visit. Make sure you have several hours to see the whole thing.

name: D WIZ
text: Loved the sea Lab. People were not very Friendly:(

name: Tammy Knight
text: Great place to bring your children

name: Shannon Johnson
text: We love going to the Island . Its in our roots

name: Jesse C
text: Fun place on the island for the kids.

name: Reconnecting
text: It was the best field trip!!!  We even dissected a squid and had a ball floated contest!

name: Ouida Shears
text: Great place to take the kids

name: Anthony Coward
text: Feb 26, 2019 Appt/Arrived/Partial Unload/Departed. SP- 434743...

name: Carey Wyatt
text: Nice experience great people!

name: Marla Billante
text: Always a fun experience, especially for kids!!
